metadata.title: The Keystone Principle - Chapters 9-12: Drift Analysis and Synergistic Dissipation
chapters_covered: 9. Formal Definition of the Cloning Operator
12. Complete Lyapunov Drift and Synergistic Framework
metadata.description: Complete drift analysis establishing Foster-Lyapunov conditions for the cloning operator. Proves positional variance contraction, velocity variance bounded expansion, boundary potential contraction, and synergistic dissipation framework combining cloning and kinetic operators.

directives.label: thm-positional-variance-contraction
directives.title: Positional Variance Contraction Under Cloning
directives.statement:
Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), there exist constants $\kappa_x > 0$, $C_x < \infty$, and a structural error threshold $R^2_{\text{spread}} > 0$, all independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:

$$\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},x}(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_x) V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) + C_x$$

Furthermore, when $V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_x$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_x$, the contraction becomes strict:

$$\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},x}(S'_1, S'_2) - V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2)] < 0$$

hypotheses.statement: Pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$ in coupled state space

conclusion.statement: Cloning operator provides geometric contraction of positional variance
properties_established: Strict contraction when variance exceeds threshold

quantitative_bounds.offset: $C_x$ includes barycenter shifts, jitter, dead walker revival
quantitative_bounds.description: Explicit bounds derived from Keystone Lemma

proof_reference.reason: Multi-step proof using variance decomposition + Keystone Lemma + bounding edge cases
proof_reference.summary: Proof strategy: (1) Decompose variance change into alive walkers + status changes, (2) Apply Keystone Lemma to bound contraction from stably alive set, (3) Bound expansion from dead walker revival, (4) Balance contraction vs expansion to prove drift inequality

directives.label: thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
directives.title: Bounded Velocity Variance Expansion from Cloning
directives.statement:
There exists a state-independent constant $C_v < \infty$ such that for any swarm $S$:

$$\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},v}(S')] \leq V_{\text{Var},v}(S) + C_v$$

Equivalently, the one-step drift satisfies:

$$\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v$$

conclusion.statement: Velocity variance expansion from cloning is uniformly bounded
properties_established: Expansion comes from inelastic collisions and velocity resets
Manageable by kinetic operator's Langevin friction

quantitative_bounds.expansion_bound: $C_v = O(\delta^2)$ where $\delta$ is velocity jitter scale
quantitative_bounds.description: Bounded expansion per step, independent of current state

proof_reference.summary: Velocity reset mechanism adds bounded jitter $\delta \zeta$ per cloned walker. Maximum expansion occurs when all walkers clone, yielding $C_v = N \cdot \delta^2 / N = \delta^2$ (N-normalized)

directives.label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
directives.title: Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
directives.statement:
Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:

$$\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b$$

Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:

$$\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0$$

hypotheses.statement: Foundational axioms satisfied, including Safe Harbor Axiom (existence of interior reward maximum with geometric separation from boundary)
Smooth barrier function exists (constructed using differential geometry and tubular neighborhood theorem)
Pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$ in coupled state space

conclusion.statement: Cloning operator provides systematic safety correction via boundary potential contraction
properties_established: Walkers near boundary are preferentially cloned inward

quantitative_bounds.offset: $C_b = 2C_{\text{total}}$ accounts for jitter and dead walker revival
quantitative_bounds.description: Explicit bounds from Safe Harbor mechanism

proof_reference.reason: Multi-lemma proof establishing enhanced cloning probability near boundary + barrier reduction mechanism
proof_reference.summary: Proof: (1) Boundary-exposed walkers have low fitness (barrier penalty), (2) They have guaranteed cloning probability $p_{\text{boundary}} > 0$, (3) When cloned, new position drawn from interior has lower barrier, (4) Combining yields geometric contraction

directives.label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
directives.title: Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
directives.statement:
Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:

$$V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)$$

**Individual Component Drifts:**

$$\begin{aligned}
\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
\end{aligned}$$

**Combined Drift:**

$$\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)$$

**Critical Property:** When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to expansion terms, drift becomes negative.

conclusion.statement: Complete characterization of cloning operator's effect on all Lyapunov components
properties_established: Cloning contracts position ($-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x}$) and boundary ($-\kappa_b W_b$)
Cloning expands velocity ($+C_v$) and inter-swarm ($+C_W$) with bounded rates
Partial contraction: drift negative when variance/boundary sufficiently large
Sets up complementary dissipation with kinetic operator

quantitative_bounds.total_drift: $-c_V \kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} - c_B \kappa_b W_b + (C_W + c_V C_x + c_V C_v + c_B C_b)$
quantitative_bounds.negativity_condition: $c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}$
quantitative_bounds.description: Explicit formula showing when drift is negative

proof_reference.summary: Sum component drifts from Theorems 10.3.1, 10.4.1, 11.3.1, 12.2.1 with respective weights $c_V$, $c_B$. Rearrange to identify contraction and expansion terms.

directives.label: thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov
directives.title: Synergistic Foster-Lyapunov Condition
directives.statement:
When the coupling constants $c_V$ and $c_B$ are chosen appropriately, the composed operator $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ satisfies a Foster-Lyapunov drift condition:

$$\mathbb{E}_{\text{total}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S) + C_{\text{total}}$$

for some $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$ and $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$, both independent of $N$.

**Consequence:** This drift condition implies:
1. **Geometric ergodicity** of the Markov chain on the alive state space
2. **Exponential convergence** to the quasi-stationary distribution
3. **Exponentially suppressed extinction probability** in the QSD regime

hypotheses.statement: Foundational axioms satisfied for both cloning and kinetic operators
Coupling constants satisfy: $c_V \kappa_x > C'_x/V_{\text{Var},x}$, $c_V \kappa_v > 1$, $\kappa_W V_W > C_W + C'_W$
Kinetic operator drift inequalities (from companion document)

conclusion.statement: Full Euclidean Gas (cloning + kinetic) satisfies Foster-Lyapunov drift condition with N-uniform constants
properties_established: Geometric contraction of total Lyapunov function
Mean time to extinction exponentially large: $\tau_{\text{ext}} \sim e^{\Theta(N)}$

quantitative_bounds.offset: $C_{\text{total}} = C_W + C'_W + c_V(C_x + C'_x + C_v + C'_v) + c_B(C_b + C'_b)$
quantitative_bounds.description: Explicit formula combining cloning and kinetic constants

proof_reference.reason: Requires combining results from this document (cloning drift) with companion document (kinetic drift)
proof_reference.summary: Proof strategy: (1) This document proves cloning drift inequalities, (2) Companion document proves kinetic drift inequalities, (3) Compose via tower property: E_total = E_kin[E_clone[·]], (4) Choose coupling constants to ensure net contraction of each component

directives.label: attr-kinetic-necessity
directives.title: Necessity of the Kinetic Operator
directives.statement:
The cloning operator alone cannot guarantee convergence to a quasi-stationary distribution. Specifically:

1. **Velocity variance accumulation:** The bounded expansion $+C_v$ per step can accumulate without bound over infinite time if not countered.

2. **Inter-swarm divergence:** The bounded expansion $+C_W$ means the two coupled swarms can drift arbitrarily far apart without inter-swarm correction.

3. **No velocity equilibrium:** Cloning has no mechanism to dissipate kinetic energy toward a target distribution.

Therefore, the **kinetic operator is essential** to:
- Contract $V_{\text{Var},v}$ via Langevin friction (overcoming $C_v$)
- Contract $V_W$ via hypocoercive drift and confining potential (overcoming $C_W$)
- Establish velocity equilibrium with the Gibbs distribution

hypotheses.statement: Only cloning operator applied (no kinetic operator)

conclusion.statement: Cloning alone is insufficient for convergence - kinetic operator is essential

proof_reference.summary: Direct from drift inequalities: Cloning has $\Delta V_{\text{Var},v} \leq C_v$ and $\Delta V_W \leq C_W$ (bounded expansion). Over $T$ steps, these accumulate to $O(T)$, growing without bound. Only kinetic operator provides contraction.
